meanings.definition: Civilian clothing worn by military personnel when off duty.
meanings.sent1: After work, the soldiers changed into their civies to go home.
meanings.sent2: On weekends, he prefers to wear civies instead of his uniform.
meanings.sent3: The army ants decided to have a 'civies only' party in the anthill.
meanings.sent4: The camouflage of the soldiers' civies blended perfectly with the cityscape.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the hero always wore his lucky civies for battle.

meanings.definition: Civilian clothes or attire, as opposed to a uniform.
meanings.sent1: She donated her old civies to the charity for those in need.
meanings.sent2: The students were excited for the school dance and planned their best civies.
meanings.sent3: The penguins looked quite dapper in their tiny civies at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The artist's civies were as colorful as a rainbow in the gray city streets.
meanings.sent5: The detective always solved the case in his trusty civies.
